name: Shanghai Chicken Wings
description: This wing sauce isn't better than Buffalo sauce, but that's not really the point. It's just another example of how fried wings drenched in sauce can be so delicious.
recipeIngredient: 1 pound chicken wings, drumsticks and wings separated, tips discarded
4 stalks celery, ends tried, cut into matchsticks

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together the hoisin, rice wine vinegar, garlic, chili flakes, and five-spice powder in a medium-sized bowl. Set aside.
Pour enough oil to come up 3-inches in a 4-quart saucepan. Turn the heat to medium and bring oil to 360 degrees.
Add as many chicken wings as will fit in one layer, and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Repeat process with remaining wings.
Drain wings on paper towels, and then toss with the sauce. Serve with celery.
